name: Introduction to Ethics
description: This course covers the basic principles of ethics, including moral reasoning and ethical theory.

name: Moral Theology
description: This course provides an in-depth examination of the theological foundations of morality, including an exploration of ethical thought from various religious traditions.

name: Philosophy of Religion
description: This course explores the philosophical implications of religious beliefs, including the arguments for and against the existence of God.

name: History of Ethics
description: This course traces the development of ethical thought from ancient to modern times, highlighting the impact of social and political context on ethical theory.

name: Contemporary Ethics
description: This course examines current ethical issues, including topics in bioethics, environmentalism, and public policy.
